com.mycompany.a1

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mycompany.a1.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fixed, Movable

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Class GameObject sets up the location using the X and Y axis points It will make sure that the object is within parameters It will also be the one to actually set the size and color instead of passing it to a parent class
    Author:
    Alexander Alestra

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameObject(int color, int size)
      The game object will set the object's color and size then will set the location

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getColor()
      This will get the given object's color
      java.lang.String getColortoString()
      This will get the color that is passed as an rgb value.
      int getSize()
      This will get the given object's size from the child classes that will be passed
      float getX()
      This will retrieve the x point for the given object
      float getY()
      This will retrieve the y point for the given object
      void setColor(int color)
      This setter will set the color of the object
      void setLocation(float x, float y)
      This will get the x and y location of the object then it will set it as a new point called location
      void setX(float x)
      Setting up the X axis point to where it must be within the 1000 and 0 mark
      void setY(float y)
      Setting up the Y axis point to where it must be within the 1000 and 0 mark
